summary: Adds a Baby Netch Companion named Squishy
descriptionHtml:
[size=12][B][center][color=red]Introduction:[/center][/B][/color][/size]
"Squishy" is a fully functional Netch Companion for Skyrim. Right now he acts as a standard Netch Companion and has everything needed to function. The 1.1 version is currently a working BETA.

I have a huge update with a quest and everything coming sometime in the near future (predicted completion date 3/10). As of right now I am dealing with some domestic issues. So until I'm satisfied with the finished product, I will not be posting another update. Everything will be done all at once though (hopefully), so no worries! ;)

Please stay tuned kids, elders, jarls, lizards, cats, men, mer, (random custom race here), aedra, and daedra! And for the love of Talos, avoid an arrow in the knee from excessive waiting!

[size=12][B][center][color=red]Location:[/B][/center][/color][/size]
Squishy can be found outside by the sawmill in Riverwood (for now). Directly across the river from the Riverwood gate. Should be fairly easy to see. Though Squishy may wander a bit, so do look around if you cant see Squishy.

[list]Stats for Squishy:
[*]Is set as essential
[*]Height 0.3 Weight 50
[*]Unaggressive, Average Confidence, helps friends and allies
[*]Can carry up to 50 weight (Squishy is a baby)
[*]Can be told to wait (it's a netch, it can't chop wood or cook lol!), follow, and dismiss
[*]Levels with the player. (base level 10, max 80)
[/list]
Featured here is clip of Squishy and my mentor [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3977884/?]DragonDude1029[/url]'s new mod (outdated video keep in mind lots of changes to both mods lol) [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49784/?]Equipping Overhaul[/url]
[youtube]jO25garKY-w[/youtube]

[size=12][B][center][color=red]Requirements:[/B][/center][/color][/size]
Skyrim
Latest patch
Dragonborn (it is required) Sorry :p
SKSE

[size=12][B][center][color=red]Updates On Progress:[/B][/center][/color][/size]

My goal is to make a vanilla styled dungeon using some basic pieces from the Dragonborn DLC. Hopefully it will transition well when I'm done and you'll feel as if you're in Skyrim and Solsthiem simultaneously. I've still got quite a lot of ideas for future plans, but those will have to wait until I have more time and (hopefully) skill.

[list]
[*][color=yellow]Follower Package (Done)
[*]Dungeon Design (Done)
[*]Navmeshing (Done)
[*]FX & Additional FX (Done)
[*]Renaming Cell Properties (Done)
[*]Lights (Done)
[*]Fixed Floor Seams (Done)
[*]Rearranged Items (Done)
[*]Additional Clutter, Flora, and Lighting added (Done)
[*]Expanded Certain Rooms/Added more Flora and Fauna (Done)
[*]Misc Items/Objects added due to necessity (Done)
[*]Dungeon Layout altered for immersion/more lights (Done)
[*]Doors and Basic Link to World (Done)
[*]NPCs (Done)[/color]
[*]Cell Cleaning (WIP)
[*]Idles and activators (WIP)
[*]Generate LOD & LOS (WIP)
[*]Quest (TBA)
[/list]

[size=12][B][center][color=red]Known Bugs[/B][/center][/color][/size]
As of right now Squishy may make your adopted children afraid (like Dawnguard death-hounds). I am planning on fixing this when I'm done with other stuff I'm working on. Please understand ;) Thanks.

[size=12][B][center][color=red]Permissions & Special Thanks:[/B][/center][/color][/size]
-Please do not use Squishy for any other purposes without my permission first. Thanks.
-Squishy is Nexus Exclusive please respect my wishes. (I've made one exception so far for the Chinese translation).
-[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/4672007/?]DarkFox127[/url] for his Animal Companion Tutorial and scripts. Without them I wouldn't even have Squishy at all. Thank you very much.
-Thank You very much to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3977884/?tb=mods&pUp=1]DragonDude1029[/url] for questing and level design advice, at this point you're the reason this a much better mod than it could have been if I had been by myself.
author: VonDarkness
